sn11.17:1.2: Now at that time the Buddha had gone into retreat for the day’s meditation.
sn11.17:1.3: Then Sakka, lord of gods, and Brahmā Sahampati approached the Buddha and stationed themselves one by each door-post.
sn11.17:1.4: Then Sakka recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn11.17:2.1: “Rise, hero! Victor in battle, with burden put down,
sn11.17:2.4: like the moon on the fifteenth night.”
sn11.17:3.1: “Lord of gods, that’s not how to pay homage to the Realized Ones.
sn11.17:3.2: This is how it should be done:
sn11.17:4.1: ‘Rise, hero! Victor in battle, leader of the caravan,
sn11.17:4.3: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!
sn11.17:4.4: There will be those who understand!’”
